com.crawljax.core

Class CrawlerExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.concurrent.AbstractExecutorService
      • java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor
        • com.crawljax.core.CrawlerExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Executor, ExecutorService

    public class CrawlerExecutor
extends ThreadPoolExecutor
    Main Executor inheriting ThreadPoolExecutor to implement the beforeExecute, afterExecute and terminated. Every time a new Crawler is added to this Executor by its ThreadPoolExecutor.execute(Runnable) function a new Thread is created when there are no more free threads. If there is a free (old) unused thread left the Crawler will be loaded into that Thread. So Threads will be reused, at most numberOfThreads will be created. The number of Crawlers active at the same time will be the maximum of the number of Threads. If there are no more Threads left, Crawlers will be stored in a workQueue until a Thread will become available.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Stefan Lenselink

    • Constructor Detail

      • CrawlerExecutor

        public CrawlerExecutor(int numberOfThreads)
        Default CrawlerExecutor. using the configured number of threads, no timeout a Stack as workQueue to support Depth-first crawling and the local ThreadFactory.
        Parameters:
        numberOfThreads - number of threads.

      • shutdownNow

        public List<Runnable> shutdownNow(boolean isAbort)
        shutdown the CrawlerExecutor, depending on the argument issue a abort or normal shutdown.
        Parameters:
        isAbort - if set to true indicating this is abort instead of normal shutdown.
        Returns:
